premises: Either the mind is separate from the body or the mind and body are the same, but not both
The mind is separate from the body
conclusions: The mind and body are not the same
incorrect conclusions: The mind and body are the same
The mind is not separate from the body

premises: Either moral actions are determined by society or they are determined by individual reasoning, but not both
Moral actions are determined by society
conclusions: Moral actions are not determined by individual reasoning
incorrect conclusions: Moral actions are determined by individual reasoning
Moral actions are not determined by society

premises: Either knowledge comes from experience or knowledge is innate, but not both
incorrect conclusions: Knowledge does not come from experience
